abstract_summ: Sub-exponential and exponential models were developed to analyze and predict the progression of COVID-19 epidemic.While research is ongoing on the transmission dynamics of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus, it is important to come up with epidemic models that can describe the main stages of the progression of the associated COVID-19 respiratory disease.BACKGROUND Several countries adopted lockdown to slowdown the exponential transmission of the COVID-19 epidemic.The model captures the highly age-dependent progression of COVID-19 and is able to describe the day-by-day advancement of an infected individual in a modern health care system.This unprecedented situation calls for rapid and accurate mathematical models to best inform public health policies.
title_summ: Multi-parametric disease dynamics study and analysis of the COVID-19 epidemic and implementation of population-wide intrusions: The Indian perspectiveModeling COVID-19 epidemics in an Excel spreadsheet: Democratizing the access to first-hand accurate predictions of epidemic outbreaksData-Driven Study of the COVID-19 Pandemic via Age-Structured Modelling and Prediction of the Health System Failure in Brazil amid Diverse Intervention StrategiesEpidemiological monitoring and control perspectives: application of a parsimonious modelling framework to the COVID-19 dynamics in FranceCovid-19 Incidence Rate Evolution Modeling using Dual Wave Gaussian-Lorentzian Composite FunctionsBeta regression with spatio-temporal effects as a tool for hospital impact analysis of initial phase epidemics: the case of COVID-19 in SpainHow high and long will the COVID-19 wave be?A data-driven approach to model and predict the COVID-19 epidemic and the required capacity for the German health systemAge-stratified model of the COVID-19 epidemic to analyze the impact of relaxing lockdown measures: nowcasting and forecasting for SwitzerlandUnravelling the Myths of R(0) in Controlling the Dynamics of COVID-19 Outbreak: a Modelling PerspectiveA novel IDEA: The impact of serial interval on a modified-Incidence Decay and Exponential Adjustment (m-IDEA) model for projections of daily COVID-19 casesPrediction of the transition from sub-exponential to the exponential transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and epidemic nowcasting for metro-zones: Experiences from Chennai-Metro-Merge, India.The effect of vertical confinement and release in Brazil.COVID-19 pandemics modeling with SEIR(+CAQH), social distancing, and age stratification.
title_abstract_phrases: The model captures the highly age-dependent progression of COVID-19 and is able to describe the day-by-day advancement of an infected individual in a modern health care system.Results of fitting GLC based models to incidence rate trends of 20 different countries proves that the models can empirically explain the growth and decay trajectory Covid-19 infections in a given population.While research is ongoing on the transmission dynamics of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus, it is important to come up with epidemic models that can describe the main stages of the progression of the associated COVID-19 respiratory disease.Sub-exponential and exponential models were developed to analyze and predict the progression of COVID-19 epidemic.This research presents a mathematical model to empirically assess measures related to various pandemic containment strategies, their similarities and a probabilistic estimate on the evolution of Covid-19 incidence rates.
